title: Memorable Moment 2024
summary: As a NASA Community Anchor, Union Station (Kansas City, KS) has welcomed over 1,100 students from different Kansas City area schools to our Spectra programming, which includes all expense paid field trips, Planetarium shows, Observation Nights, and tabling at KC PrideFest. This program has allowed us to increase our reach to the Kansas City LGBTQIA+ […]

title: Pentagon’s commercial satellite internet services program soars to $13 billion
summary: DoD is raising its Proliferated Low Earth Orbit (PLEO) Satellite-Based Services program from an initial $900 million ceiling to a projected $13 billion

title: NASA Helps Find Thawing Permafrost Adds to Near-Term Global Warming
summary: Earth’s far northern reaches have locked carbon underground for millennia. New research paints a picture of a landscape in change. A new study, co-authored by NASA scientists, details where and how greenhouse gases are escaping from the Earth’s vast northern permafrost region as the Arctic warms. The frozen soils encircling the Arctic from Alaska to […]

title: NASA Group Amplifies Voices of Employees with Disabilities
summary: Kathy Clark started her career at NASA’s Glenn Research Center in Cleveland straight out of high school, and when offered either a job as an accountant or a job in training, the choice was crystal clear. “I started in training, I’ve stayed in training, and I’ll probably retire in training,” said Clark, now a human […]

title: NASA Relaunches Mentor-Protégé Program to Fill Supply Chain Gaps
summary: In an effort to grow new commercial markets that support the future of space exploration, scientific discovery, and aeronautics research, NASA is preparing to relaunch its Mentor-Protégé Program for contractors on Friday, Nov. 1. The program originally was launched to encourage NASA prime contractors, or mentors, to enter into agreements with eligible small businesses, or […]

title: New NASA Instrument for Studying Snowpack Completes Airborne Testing
summary: Summer heat has significant effects in the mountainous regions of the western United States. Melted snow washes from snowy peaks into the rivers, reservoirs, and streams that supply millions of Americans with freshwater—as much as 75% of the annual freshwater supply for some states. But as climate change brings winter temperatures to new highs, these […]

title: Phillip Ingle, Morgan Stanley – Commercial Space Transformers
summary: In this episode of Commercial Space Transformers SpaceNews Senior Staff Writer Jason Rainbow speaks with Phillip Ingle, Managing Director, Investment Banking Division, Morgan Stanley.

title: Korean SAR satellite firm Lumir goes public; Shares slide after initial rally
summary: SEOUL, South Korea — South Korean satellite developer Lumir saw its share decline steadily following a brief rally on its first day of trading. Since going public on South Korea’s […]

title: ESA Selects Companies to Develop in-Orbit Fuel Storage and Refilling Tech
summary: The European Space Agency has selected ArianeGroup, GMV Aerospace and Defence, MT Aerospace, SAB Aerospace, and The Exploration Company to develop in-orbit fuel storage and refilling capabilities. ESA’s selection of the five companies was announced on 9 October during a Future Space Transportation Award Ceremony in Paris. The selections were made as part of the […]

title: Gateway: Centering Science
summary: Gateway is set to advance science in deep space, bringing groundbreaking research opportunities to lunar orbit.
